data.meta_description: Onscreen, Bruce Willis dodged bullets and explosions in Die Hard and countless action films, making him the biggest movie star of the â90s. Offscreen, he dodged the tabloid press and became so determined to live a private life he moved to one of the smallest towns in Idaho. But he didnât just want tâ¦
data.text:
When I came across this podcast, I thought it sounded interesting, so I gave it a try. All but the final episode had been released by then.

Wow! After about 15 minutes I was completely hooked and didnât want to stop. Itâs like a great book you canât put down and stop reading. I had this playing while I did laundry, ran errands, everything.

Iâve never been a huge fan of Bruce Willis, but I always liked him well enough, as an actor. From Moonlighting to more recent movies, heâs funny, a little goofy and usually kicking butt. I always thought he seemed a little arrogant interacting IRL though.

This podcast gave a lot of insight into what kind of human being Bruce Willis is, and the way he perceives others, which explains a lot about the way he interacts with the world in general.

As a rule I donât look up information on actors or follow gossip shows, etc. Sometimes you canât avoid hearing something if itâs plastered everywhere, but usually I know nothing except what movies/shows theyâve appeared in.

I say that to say this: I never thought Iâd be interested in hearing about an actorâs personal life, but because of the circumstances and the way this podcast is created and presented, I thoroughly enjoyed it.
